page.title: 20Mousehole Harbour (2)
page.content:
In earlier times the harbour had to be enlarged to accomodate the fishing fleet of about 40 sailing boats in the 1850's but today there is only one boat sailing from{Mousehole engaged in fishing. This boat is the {'Talisman',}but although it is engaged in fishing, it is mainly involved with taking trippers or visitors on longer daily fishing trips for sharks, or shorter trips to catch mackeral in {Mounts Bay.
At this point thanks must be recorded to{Mr. Mike Reynolds and his {family}for information about Mousehole and the various activities available to the local community. Also thanks to{Andrew Walton and Clive {Symons of St. Paul's School}for helping in the survey, amenity count and some of the typing.
